title: Ticket #979: DAGMan lazy log file code broken on Windows
description: The current lazy log file code relies on inode #s to identify log files; but this doesn't work on Windows (we get 0 for the inode for every file).
remarks:
2009-Nov-18 15:33:55 by wenger:
Also see gittrac #205: realpath() on Win32 and gittrac #790: locking problem between shadows on windows in user job log.

2009-Nov-19 14:46:25 by wenger:
Just committed a change that should fix this, but it hasn't been tested yet on Windows, so I'm not closing the ticket. The change is that on Windows we now index on the path returned by _fullpath(). (On Unix/Linux, we index on a string that's a combination of device number and inode number.) (This fix will be in 7.4.1.)

2009-Nov-23 16:04:46 by wenger:
Todd M says 7.4.1 pre-release works on Windows, so I'm resolving this ticket.
